insight: Transfers are usually instant. Bonus promotions can occasionally increase the ratio.
terms: All transfers are final and cannot be reversed.
The name on both loyalty accounts must match exactly to complete the transfer.
Aeroplan miles expire after 18 months of inactivity unless you earn, redeem, or transfer in more miles.

insight: Allow up to 48 hours. A 5,000-point bonus is added for every 60,000 points transferred.
terms: Transfers typically post within two days but can take longer during promotions.
You must transfer in increments of 1,000 Membership Rewards points.
Once points reach Marriott Bonvoy they follow the program's 24-month activity expiration policy.

insight: Transfers are instant. Redemptions start at 3,500 points for off-peak Category 1 hotels.
terms: Only primary cardholders can initiate transfers to World of Hyatt.
Hyatt accounts must be open and in good standing prior to the transfer.
Hyatt points do not expire with at least one earning or redeeming activity every 24 months.

insight: Transfers are instant, but you cannot transfer United miles back to Chase once complete.
terms: MileagePlus accounts must belong to you or an authorized user on the credit card.
United miles never expire, but award space is subject to capacity controls.
Changes and cancellations follow United's award ticket fee structure.

insight: Transfers post within 24 hours. LifeMiles regularly discounts award bookings by 10–15%.
terms: LifeMiles transfers must be made in 1,000-point increments.
Purchased, pooled, or transferred-in LifeMiles follow the program's standard expiration rules.
Award tickets booked with LifeMiles are subject to partner carrier taxes and surcharges.

insight: Expect 1–2 day processing. Watch for seasonal promotions on all-inclusive partner resorts.
terms: Choice Privileges requires a minimum transfer of 1,000 ThankYou points.
Transferred points expire according to Choice's standard terms, typically two years from the deposit date.
Award availability varies by property and can be capacity-controlled during peak periods.
